titulo: Print to thermal printer from browser and JavaScript
mensaje_inicio: Finally a way to print from JavaScript to thermal printers in an easy and free way by using a plugin
paso_1_uso: Install your printer. You can use the manufacturer drivers or generic drivers.
paso_2_uso: Print a page from the control panel, so you can make sure your printer is working
paso_3_uso: Share your printer. You can look at my tutorial here (in spanish)
paso_5_uso: Start the plugin and give it permission if needed. Remember that the plugin will run in the background. You can stop it from the task manager
paso_6_uso: Go to the example and try it
paso_7_uso: If everything goes well, you can use the plugin!
caracteristica_1: Paper cut, emphasize text, underline, reverse printing
caracteristica_7: Barcodes: Codabar, Code 128, Code 39, Code 93, Ean, Ean8, PDF417, Two of Five ITF, UPC A and UPC E
caracteristica_9: Compatible with frameworks that use JavaScript. For example: Vue, Angular and React
caracteristica_10: Compatible with any programming language that can talk HTTP. At the moment there's a Java, Python and JavaScript version and you can create your own conector too
caracteristica_11: Print local, base64 encoded and internet images
caracteristica_12: Define custom characters i.e. currency symbols or accents
caracteristica_13: Print text with accents, ñ, spanish, korean and many symbols by using charcode pages and iconv
caracteristica_14: It works on Windows, Linux (debian based) and Raspberry Pi (Raspbian). There is also an Android version that you can check on the top of the page
modo_de_uso_1: Include the Impresora.js file in your webapp. This can be achieved by including the file:
modo_de_uso_2: Or by copying the full code inside your project. This will be useful if you use Angular or some framework. Just remember to use the updated source code
modo_de_uso_3: Now you can use the Impresora class. You can create an instance of it, call methods and finally call to imprimirEnImpresora this way:
modo_de_uso_4: And that's all!. Remember to take a look at the Impresora.js source code so you can see more functions to align, change size, print barcodes and so on
parrafo_1_ejemplo: This example will print a test ticket in the selected printer:
aviso_requisito_plugin:
Remember that the plugin must be running in the background. Select your printer and print an example ticket.
Important: if the list is empty, make sure the plugin is running in the background
aviso_mas_ejemplos: You can see more examples in the GitHub repo (in spanish) or try them online
ejemplo_imprimir_ticket: Example to print to thermal printer from JavaScript
faq1: Start plugin with Windows You can create a shortcut in the Startup folder
faq2: Run plugin in Linux or Mac Currently it can run on Linux, Windows and Raspberry Pi. There will be a MacOS version when I can get a computer with that os
faq3: Remove footer with my credits You can remove them by when you get a license
faq4: CORS error when using JavaScript This error only happens when using client-side JavaScript in the browser. Remember that you must use https on your site or it has to be exactly localhost
faq5: Print special chars like á,é,í or the ñ letter Please check the examples and demo, there's an example there
sitio_open_source: This webpage is open source. You can see the source code at GitHub
titulo_pagina: Plugin to print to thermal printers directly from browser by using JavaScript
